title: RITO, shouldn't Tryndamere be part of the rework vote?
body: Don't get me wrong, I love that you actually ask us which champion we want reworked, but IMO Trynda  needs it just as bad as the rest 5.

replies.body: He needs it way more than most of them imo. While a champ like Shyvana or Volibear might not be fulfilling the fantasy of their kit, at least they're not causing any problems. Tryndamere is not only dull but a blatantly unhealthy statcheck, and his ult (invincibility even under hard CC) should have never existed in the game. Babysitting him top lane while he plays pve is a mindnumbing chore, especially with how incredibly forgiving his kit is. Why they chose to BUFF him in pbe is beyond me.
Tbh, he was absolutely trash-tier in the short time (early season 2?) he couldn't ult while CC'd.  Then again, that was probably just another example of Morello being ahead of the curve on balance.

Morello was living proof you could be Silver and still balance the game really well. He may not have had the mechanical skill to do well on the ladder, but he definitely had the knowledge of the game required for his job. It's weird though, that people complained about him so much when I played, but when he left people almost immediately wanted him back again.

After playing the other MOBAs, I'm not sure what exactly is so bad about revolving around an ult a lot? Sometimes the ult is really what makes your kit, and sometimes it isn't. Evening out the power so everyone has roughly equal balance in the abilities of your kit just seems like it would make the game really... bland, to me. Nobody would really have this moment of "his ult is up we'd better be careful/he used his ult, now he's weak, go in and punish him" sine graph of power.

Sometimes, revolving around your ult really is the thing that makes your kit unique and interesting. Flat-lining the power curve of heroes and champions is straight-up boring to play. And realistically, Noct being reliant on his R sounds about like what I'd expect from this game's Spectre expy and his lore.

Honestly, why couldn't Riven be put up there? I'd like to rid the game of one less anomaly that gets a get out of jail free card for nerfs.
She doesn't need a VGU, they just need to get rid of animation-cancelling bullshit, make her mechanics more streamlined and do something about conqueror and CDR creep.

> She doesn't need a VGU, they just need to get rid of animation-cancelling bullshit

That there is the problem. Her core as a champ has become the animation cancelling. They coming anywhere near that and her identity gameplaywise would crumble.

The mains want it. So if they want it, they should lose some damage from her kit. She should be more of a duelist than a burst fighter with that mechanic. CDR needs to be clipped from a bunch of items, and Conq needs to just straight up leave alone. We are nerfing the rune so much that Riven will practically stay on top of all other fighters while fucking the rest of them over.

Yeah, she along with {{champion:58}} and {{champion:24}}(midgame back then) have always been the case studies for when items or other factors are overtuned.  Remember red elixirs?  Those 2 are the reason they got removed.  If they want to keep animation-cancelling integral to her kit, that's fine, give her a higher skill floor, but they have to trim down her damage as a tradeoff.  If they insist on keeping conq in the game, just something as simple as a 2-second internal cooldown on stacking could at least remove the burst cheese for a similar payoff for staying in extended fights.

"Can I go off the board and vote for Tryndamere instead? He's one of the most binary, stat-checky, one dimensional pieces of horse shit in the game and its about time something changed to where its not just a question of "How many stats do you have?" as to whether or not you can fight him."

I hate Tryndamere but I don't think he needs a full VGU.

Trying to be objective about Tryndamere here, the reasons:
1. Tryndamere has a pretty large playerbase that enjoys playing him.
2. He fulfils a niche in the game that doesn't really overlap much with any other champion.
3. His thematics and kit go together pretty nicely, he's a rage fueled Berserker warrior.. plays like it.

Reasons to rework Tryndamere:
1. His graphics aren't the best but they aren't too bad, his voice lines are bad though.
2. He is stat-checky, and there's some frustration dealing with him.
3. His W is kind of a weird and outdated kinda skill.

So I think Tryndamere overall, would be more like a mini update - some stats changed around, maybe 1 spell completely changed (W) - but fulfilling a simular function, the others minorly adjusted, with a new model and voice lines, such as Ezreal or Morgana. But not a total VGU where he's thrown into the blender like Aatrox or Irelia.
